page.title: 19LIGHT INDUSTRY IN GOMSHALL
page.content: Five of us went to visit Gomshall Tannery on the A25 just over a mile from Shere. After we had found the office we were taken around the tannery. Three of the fathers in our school work there. We saw the skins being washed and dried. The skins are then died, dried again, and stretched. There were many machines that were huge. It was noisey and very busy. Suede and leather skins are produced in 200 different colours. Each week 150,000 square feet of suede leather is made. Altogether there are 300 people employed in the tannery. There are only two other tanneries in England. When the skins are ready they are packed into boxes and sent all over the world. The boxes are taken by lorry to ports and airports in England. Many skins go to Italy.
